headline.main: STUDY CITED AS SIGN OF HEALTH PERIL TO CHILDREN OF POOR IN U.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: A survey by a Boston hospital that found an unexpectedly large number of children with stunted growth may be an indication of ''silent undernutrition'' among America's poor, a Harvard health specialist said today. ''What worries me most is that the early clinical warnings of damage to health are showing up under current spending levels,'' Larry Brown, the health specialist, told a Senate panel. ''A child's brain cannot wait for economic upswings.''
